error.cloud_user: Ubiquiti Cloud users are not Supported. Please use a Local only user.
error.protect_version: Minimum required version is v1.20.0. Please upgrade UniFi Protect and then retry.

discovery_confirm.description: Do you want to set up {name} ({ip_address})? You will need a local user created in your UniFi OS Console to log in with. Ubiquiti Cloud Users will not work. For more information: {local_user_documentation_url}
discovery_confirm.title: UniFi Protect Discovered

data_description.host: Hostname or IP address of your UniFi Protect device.

user.description: You will need a local user created in your UniFi OS Console to log in with. Ubiquiti Cloud Users will not work. For more information: {local_user_documentation_url}
user.title: UniFi Protect Setup

confirm.description:
Starting on July 22nd, 2024, Ubiquiti will require all cloud users to enroll in multi-factor authentication (MFA), which is incompatible with Home Assistant.

It would be best to migrate to using a [local user]({learn_more}) as soon as possible to keep the integration working.

Confirming this repair will trigger a re-authentication flow to enter the needed authentication credentials.
confirm.title: Ubiquiti Cloud Users are not Supported

cloud_user.title: Ubiquiti Cloud Users are not Supported

deprecate_hdr_switch.description:
UniFi Protect v3 added a new state for HDR (auto). As a result, the HDR Mode Switch has been replaced with an HDR Mode Select, and it is deprecated.

Below are the detected automations or scripts that use one or more of the deprecated entities:
{items}
The above list may be incomplete and it does not include any template usages inside of dashboards. Please update any templates, automations or scripts accordingly.
deprecate_hdr_switch.title: HDR Mode Switch Deprecated

deprecate_package_sensor.description:
The package event sensor never tripped because of the way events are reported in UniFi Protect. As a result, the sensor is deprecated and will be removed.

Below are the detected automations or scripts that use one or more of the deprecated entities:
{items}
The above list may be incomplete and it does not include any template usages inside of dashboards. Please update any templates, automations or scripts accordingly.
deprecate_package_sensor.title: Package Event Sensor Deprecated

deprecate_smart_sensor.description:
The unified "Detected Object" sensor for smart detections is now deprecated. It has been replaced with individual smart detection binary sensors for each smart detection type.

Below are the detected automations or scripts that use one or more of the deprecated entities:
{items}
The above list may be incomplete and it does not include any template usages inside of dashboards. Please update any templates, automations or scripts accordingly.
deprecate_smart_sensor.title: Smart Detection Sensor Deprecated

confirm.description: The `unifiprotect.set_doorbell_message` service is deprecated in favor of the new Doorbell Text entity added to each Doorbell device. It will be removed in v2023.3.0. Please update to use the [`text.set_value` service]({link}).
confirm.title: set_doorbell_message is Deprecated

confirm.description: Are you sure you want to run unsupported versions of UniFi Protect? This may cause your Home Assistant integration to break.
confirm.title: UniFi Protect Early Access enabled

start.description:
You are either running an Early Access version of UniFi Protect (v{version}) or opt-ed into a release channel that is not the Official Release Channel.

As these Early Access releases may not be tested yet, using it may cause the UniFi Protect integration to behave unexpectedly. [Read more about Early Access and Home Assistant]({learn_more}).

Submit to dismiss this message.
start.title: UniFi Protect Early Access enabled

ea_setup_failed.description:
You are using v{version} of UniFi Protect which is an Early Access version. An unrecoverable error occurred while trying to load the integration. Please restore a backup of a stable release of UniFi Protect to continue using the integration.

Error: {error}
ea_setup_failed.title: Setup error using Early Access version

confirm.description: Are you sure you want to run unsupported versions of UniFi Protect? This may cause your Home Assistant integration to break.
confirm.title: v{version} is an Early Access version

start.description:
You are using v{version} of UniFi Protect which is an Early Access version. [Early Access versions are not supported by Home Assistant](https://www.home-assistant.io/integrations/unifiprotect#about-unifi-early-access) and it is recommended to go back to a stable release as soon as possible.

By submitting this form you have either [downgraded UniFi Protect](https://www.home-assistant.io/integrations/unifiprotect#downgrading-unifi-protect) or you agree to run an unsupported version of UniFi Protect.
start.title: v{version} is an Early Access version

ea_warning.title: UniFi Protect v{version} is an Early Access version

confirm.description: Are you sure you want to leave RTSPS disabled for {camera}?
confirm.title: RTSPS is disabled on camera {camera}

start.description:
RTSPS is disabled on the camera {camera}. RTSPS is required to be able to live stream your camera within Home Assistant. If you do not enable RTSPS, it may create an additional load on your UniFi Protect NVR, as any live video players will default to rapidly pulling snapshots from the camera.

Please [enable RTSPS]({learn_more}) on the camera and then come back and confirm this repair.
start.title: RTSPS is disabled on camera {camera}

confirm.description: Are you sure you want to leave RTSPS disabled for {camera}?
confirm.title: RTSPS is disabled on camera {camera}

start.description:
RTSPS is disabled on the camera {camera}. RTSPS is required to live stream your camera within Home Assistant. If you do not enable RTSPS, it may create an additional load on your UniFi Protect NVR as any live video players will default to rapidly pulling snapshots from the camera.

You may manually [enable RTSPS]({learn_more}) on your selected camera quality channel or Home Assistant can automatically enable the highest quality channel for you. Confirm this repair once you have enabled the RTSPS channel or if you want Home Assistant to enable the highest quality automatically.
start.title: RTSPS is disabled on camera {camera}

data.all_updates: Realtime metrics (WARNING: Greatly increases CPU usage)
data.allow_ea: Allow Early Access versions of Protect (WARNING: Will mark your integration as unsupported)
data.allow_ea_channel: Allow Early Access versions of Protect (WARNING: Will mark your integration as unsupported)
data.max_media: Max number of event to load for Media Browser (increases RAM usage)

init.description: Realtime metrics option should only be enabled if you have enabled the diagnostics sensors and want them updated in realtime. If not enabled, they will only update once every 15 minutes.
init.title: UniFi Protect Options

add_doorbell_text.description: Adds a new custom message for doorbells.

device_id.description: Any device from the UniFi Protect instance you want to change. In case you have multiple Protect Instances.
device_id.name: UniFi Protect NVR

message.description: New custom message to add for doorbells. Must be less than 30 characters.
message.name: Custom message

add_doorbell_text.name: Add custom doorbell text

remove_doorbell_text.description: Removes an existing message for doorbells.

device_id.description: Any device from the UniFi Protect instance you want to change. In case you have multiple Protect Instances.
device_id.name: UniFi Protect NVR

message.description: Existing custom message to remove for doorbells.
message.name: Custom message

remove_doorbell_text.name: Remove custom doorbell text

remove_privacy_zone.description: Use to remove a privacy zone from a camera.

device_id.description: Camera you want to remove privacy zone from.
device_id.name: Camera

name.description: The name of the zone to remove.
name.name: Privacy Zone Name

remove_privacy_zone.name: Remove camera privacy zone

set_chime_paired_doorbells.description: Use to set the paired doorbell(s) with a smart chime.

device_id.description: The chimes to link to the doorbells to.
device_id.name: Chime

doorbells.description: The doorbells to link to the chime.
doorbells.name: Doorbells

set_chime_paired_doorbells.name: Set chime paired doorbells

set_default_doorbell_text.description: Sets the default doorbell message. This will be the message that is automatically selected when a message "expires".

device_id.description: Any device from the UniFi Protect instance you want to change. In case you have multiple Protect Instances.
device_id.name: UniFi Protect NVR

message.description: The default message for your doorbell. Must be less than 30 characters.
message.name: Default message

set_default_doorbell_text.name: Set default doorbell text
